soc.client

Class ColorSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • soc.client.ColorSquare
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColorSquareLarger

    public class ColorSquare
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    This is a square box with a background color and possibly a number, checkmark, or text in it. This box can be interactive, or non-interactive. If a "resource" background color from RESOURCE_COLORS is used, will automatically have a tooltip with that resource type (sheep, wood, etc).

    Default size and minimum size are WIDTH by HEIGHT pixels, unless you call a constructor with size parameters. Using such a constructor will also increase font size of a larger ColorSquare; calling setSize or setMinimumSize won't change the font size.

    You can call method setSize(int, int) to change current size, setMinimumSize(Dimension) to change minimum. Minimum isn't set by setSize, to avoid a "disappearing" 0-height or 0-width square when layout manager calls setSize or setBounds.

    Most colorsquares in JSettlers are actually ColorSquareLarger instances: Creating that subclass was easier than changing the values of WIDTH and HEIGHT here, which are also used for setting the size of many UI elements.

    Author:
    Robert S Thomas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • RESOURCE_COLORS

        public static final java.awt.Color[] RESOURCE_COLORS
        Array of resource colors. 0 is CLAY, 1 is ORE, SHEEP, WHEAT, 4 is WOOD.

        Because this array has the resource types a player can hold or trade, it does not contain GOLD.

        Since:
        1.1.08

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare()
        Creates a new grey ColorSquare object without a visible value. Uses type NUMBER, non-interactive, with lower and upper limits both 0.
        See Also:
        ColorSquare(int, boolean, Color, int, int), ColorSquare(Color)

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(java.awt.Color c)
        Creates a new ColorSquare object with specified background color and without a visible value. Non-interactive. Uses type CHECKBOX.

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        See Also:
        ColorSquare(Color, int, int), ColorSquare(int, boolean, Color, int, int)

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(java.awt.Color c,
                   int w,
                   int h)
        Creates a new ColorSquare with specified background color and size, without a visible value; calls ColorSquare(Color).
        Parameters:
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        w - width in pixels
        h - height in pixels
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(java.awt.Color c,
                   int v)
        Creates a new ColorSquare object with specified background color and initial value. Type NUMBER, non-interactive, upper=99, lower=0.

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        v - initial int value
        See Also:
        ColorSquare(Color, int, int, int), ColorSquare(int, boolean, Color, int, int)

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(java.awt.Color c,
                   int v,
                   int w,
                   int h)
        Creates a new ColorSquare with specified background color, initial value, and size; calls ColorSquare(Color, int).
        Parameters:
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        v - initial int value
        w - width in pixels
        h - height in pixels
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(java.awt.Color c,
                   java.lang.String v)
        Creates a new ColorSquare object with specified background color and initial value. Type TEXT, non-interactive.

        The colorsquare's size is small by default and not changed here, so be sure to call setSize or setBounds to make the square large enough to display your text.

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        v - initial string value
        Since:
        1.1.06

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(int k,
                   boolean in,
                   java.awt.Color c)
        Creates a new ColorSquare of the specified kind and background color. Possibly interactive. For kind = NUMBER, upper=99, lower=0.

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        k - Kind: NUMBER, YES_NO, CHECKBOX, BOUNDED_INC, BOUNDED_DEC
        in - interactive flag allowing user interaction
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        See Also:
        ColorSquare(int, boolean, int, int, Color), ColorSquare(int, boolean, Color, int, int)

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(int k,
                   boolean in,
                   int w,
                   int h,
                   java.awt.Color c)
        Creates a new ColorSquare with specified kind, background color, and size; calls ColorSquare(int, boolean, Color).

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        k - Kind: NUMBER, YES_NO, CHECKBOX, BOUNDED_INC, BOUNDED_DEC
        in - interactive flag allowing user interaction
        w - width in pixels
        h - height in pixels
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • ColorSquare

        public ColorSquare(int k,
                   boolean in,
                   java.awt.Color c,
                   int upper,
                   int lower)
        Creates a new ColorSquare of the specified kind and background color. Possibly interactive, with upper and lower bounds specified for NUMBER kinds.

        A tooltip with the resource name is created if c is one of the resource colors defined in ColorSquare (CLAY, WHEAT, etc, or an element of RESOURCE_COLORS).

        Parameters:
        k - Kind: NUMBER, YES_NO, CHECKBOX, BOUNDED_INC, BOUNDED_DEC
        in - interactive flag allowing user interaction
        c - background color; creates resource-name tooltip if is a resource color
        upper - upper bound if k == NUMBER
        lower - lower bound if k == NUMBER

    • Method Detail

      • setInteractive

        public void setInteractive(boolean inter)
        Set this square to interactive or read-only mode. If read-only, user can't click the resource amount to change it.

        If square was non-interactive when constructor called, and then this method is called to make interactive, adds a mouse listener. Calling it again later could add a duplicate mouse listener, so don't toggle interactivity more than once.

        Parameters:
        inter - True for interactive, false for read-only
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • setSizesAndFont

        protected final void setSizesAndFont(int w,
                                     int h)
        Set minimum and current size of this ColorSquare. If w or h >= 4/3 of HEIGHT, also update the font size to fill the square.
        Parameters:
        w - New width
        h - New height
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int w,
                    int h)
        Set the width and height of this ColorSquare. Does not need to be a square (w != h is OK). This size will also be returned by getPreferredSize(). If setMinimumSize(Dimension) has been called, will honor that minimum width and height here.
        Overrides:
        setSize in class java.awt.Component
        Parameters:
        w - width in pixels
        h - height in pixels
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:

      • setToolTipText

        public void setToolTipText(java.lang.String tip)
        Change tooltip text or show or (if null) hide tooltip. Any previously set warning-level or zero-level tooltip text is cleared to null.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was setTooltipText with lowercase "tip".

        Overrides:
        setToolTipText in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        tip - New tip text; will create tooltip if needed. If tip is null, tooltip is removed.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        setToolTipHighWarningLevel(String, int), setToolTipLowWarningLevel(String, int), setToolTipZeroText(String)

      • setLowWarningLevel

        public void setLowWarningLevel(int warnLevel)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set low-level warning (TODO docu text)
        Parameters:
        warnLevel - If the colorsquare value is at warnLevel or lower, indicate with the warning color.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if warnLevel is above high level, or is zero. To set text for value 0, use setToolTipZeroText(String) instead. To clear the warning level, use clearLowWarningLevel() instead.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        clearLowWarningLevel(), setToolTipZeroText(String)

      • clearLowWarningLevel

        public void clearLowWarningLevel()
        If a tooltip low-warning has been set, it is also cleared TODO docu
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • setToolTipLowWarningLevel

        public void setToolTipLowWarningLevel(java.lang.String warnTip,
                                      int warnLevel)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set low-level warning, and set or clear its tooltip text. If warnTip not null, we must already have a standard tooltip text. Does not affect zero-level or high-level tooltip text.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was setTooltipLowWarningLevel with lowercase "tip".

        Parameters:
        warnTip - TODO docu - or null to clear tip text
        warnLevel - TODO docu - at or below
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setToolTipText has not yet been called and warnTip is not null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if warnLevel is above high level, or is zero. To set text for value 0, use setToolTipZeroText(String) instead. To clear the warning level, use clearLowWarningLevel() instead.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        setHighWarningLevel(int), setLowWarningLevel(int), setToolTipText(String), setToolTipZeroText(String)

      • setToolTipHighWarningLevel

        public void setToolTipHighWarningLevel(java.lang.String warnTip,
                                       int warnLevel)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set high-level warning, and set or clear its tooltip text. If warnTip not null, we must already have a standard tooltip text. Does not affect zero-level or low-level tooltip text.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was setTooltipHighWarningLevel with lowercase "tip".

        Parameters:
        warnTip - TODO docu - or null to clear tip text
        warnLevel - TODO docu - at or above
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setToolTipText has not yet been called and warnTip is not null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if warnLevel is below low-warning level.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        setHighWarningLevel(int), setLowWarningLevel(int), setToolTipText(String)

      • setToolTipZeroText

        public void setToolTipZeroText(java.lang.String zeroTip)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Set or clear zero-level tooltip text. Setting this text will also change the tooltip background color the warning color when at value 0.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was setTooltipZeroText with lowercase "tip".

        Parameters:
        zeroTip - Text to display only when value is 0, or null to not have a separate zero-level-only tip text
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setToolTipText has not yet been called and zeroTip is not null
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        setToolTipText(String), setToolTipHighWarningLevel(String, int), setToolTipLowWarningLevel(String, int)
